metadata.methodology: Weighted Pearson correlation with confidence weighting (certain=1.0, somewhat=0.7, barely=0.4)

top_predictors.interpretation: Strongest predictor - sustained engagement wins over flashy hooks
2nd strongest - often unnoticed consciously but powerful
Novelty matters - creativity valued over formula

negative_predictors.interpretation: Flashy hooks hurt preference - desperation signal
negative_predictors.note: Replace with nuanced hook_analysis in v1.1

weak_signals.interpretation: Heavily discussed in notes but doesn't predict preference

qualitative_quantitative_gaps.insight: Strong predictor but rarely articulated - creates 'background halo' effect
Heavily analyzed but doesn't affect preference decisions
Discussed as 'payoff' but actually responds to attention retention
Rarely discussed because it doesn't influence taste positively

recommended_new_variables.name: narrative_coherence
recommended_new_variables.rationale: Attention retention is top predictor; need to capture story flow quality

recommended_new_variables.name: production_polish
recommended_new_variables.rationale: Audio predicts strongly; composite of intentional audio + visual

recommended_new_variables.name: performer_execution
recommended_new_variables.rationale: Notes mention performer quality; not captured in schema

recommended_new_variables.name: engagement_curve
recommended_new_variables.rationale: Retention over time, not just total; captures 'slow burn' quality

recommended_new_variables.name: humor_execution_quality
recommended_new_variables.rationale: 49% of notes mention humor but no humor metric predicts; execution matters

barely.note: Majority are marginal calls - exploring nuanced boundaries
